comments:
Overview Description:  
    Received the following error message when adding CIMOM agent not requiring id/pw

    11/22/06 1:18:03 PM GUI8101I: Connection test to CIMOM https://9.11.213.169:5989 FAILED due to LOGIN FAILED

    The log file showed the following errors

2006.11.20 12:02:34.140-08:00 HWN099999I The method testCIMOMConnection of the Disk Manager service was invoked with parameters [[org.eclipse.aperi.common.api.CIMOM@1ff5c98]]@(-9223372036854775789;[-9223372036854775784,0,0];-9223372036854775783;BiModalSSLSocketListener0-1).   org.eclipse.aperi.disk.api.impl.DiskManagerService testCIMOMConnection
2006.11.20 12:02:34.765-08:00 HWN099992W Method invokation on thread DiskManagerThread-2 - enumerateClassNames([CIM_RegisteredProfile]) returned an error: org.sblim.wbem.cim.CIMAuthenticationException: EXT_ERR_AUTHENTICATION@(-9223372036854775772;[-9223372036854775765,0,0];-9223372036854775764;DiskManagerThread-2)   org.eclipse.aperi.disk.common.util.thread.DiskMgrThread run
2006.11.20 12:02:34.765-08:00 HWN099993E CIMException at enumerateClassNames(interop:CIM_RegisteredProfile) @(-9223372036854775784;[-9223372036854775779,0,1];-9223372036854775777;DiskManagerThread-1 - testOneCIMOMConnection([org.eclipse.aperi.common.api.CIMOM@1ff5c98]))
  org.sblim.wbem.cim.CIMAuthenticationException: EXT_ERR_AUTHENTICATION
	at org.sblim.wbem.client.CIMClientXML.transmitRequest(CIMClientXML.java:1778)
	at org.sblim.wbem.client.CIMClientXML.enumerateClassNames(CIMClientXML.java:965)
	at org.sblim.wbem.client.CIMClient.enumerateClassNames(CIMClient.java:2983)
	at org.sblim.wbem.client.CIMClient.enumerateClassNames(CIMClient.java:2938)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.aperi.disk.common.util.thread.DiskMgrThread.run(DiskMgrThread.java:257)   org.eclipse.aperi.disk.common.CIMOMManager testOneCIMOMConnection
2006.11.20 12:02:34.765-08:00 HWN099993E Exception received while trying to connect to https://9.11.213.169:5989 due to EXT_ERR_AUTHENTICATION @(-9223372036854775784;[-9223372036854775779,0,1];-9223372036854775777;DiskManagerThread-1 - testOneCIMOMConnection([org.eclipse.aperi.common.api.CIMOM@1ff5c98]))
  org.sblim.wbem.cim.CIMAuthenticationException: EXT_ERR_AUTHENTICATION
	at org.sblim.wbem.client.CIMClientXML.transmitRequest(CIMClientXML.java:1778)
	at org.sblim.wbem.client.CIMClientXML.enumerateClassNames(CIMClientXML.java:965)
	at org.sblim.wbem.client.CIMClient.enumerateClassNames(CIMClient.java:2983)
	at org.sblim.wbem.client.CIMClient.enumerateClassNames(CIMClient.java:2938)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.aperi.disk.common.util.thread.DiskMgrThread.run(DiskMgrThread.java:257)   org.eclipse.aperi.disk.common.CIMOMManager testOneCIMOMConnection
2006.11.20 12:02:34.781-08:00 HWN099990I The method testCIMOMConnection of the Disk Manager service returned [LOGIN_FAILED] @( -9223372036854775789;[-9223372036854775784,0,0];-9223372036854775783;BiModalSSLSocketListener0-1).   org.eclipse.aperi.disk.api.impl.DiskManagerService testCIMOMConnection 

Steps to Reproduce:  

     Adding CIMON agent 9.11.213.169 https:5989 namespace /interop

Actual Results:  

     Failed with 11/22/06 1:18:03 PM GUI8101I: Connection test to CIMOM https://9.11.213.169:5989 FAILED due to LOGIN FAILED

Expected Results:  

     The CIMOM agent should be added without error

Build Date & Platform:  
     
     Aperi-20061121-1100.zip build running on Windows platform
Though this is a valid defect, I have the feeling that we will need to transfer this to the SBLIM CimClient team.

This defect seems to be limited to cimoms using the HTTPS protocol.
The same procedure for cimoms using HTTP works fine.
OK, an HTTPS CIMOM with no username & password strikes me as a weird thing. I would consider deferring this defect out of R2.

I've spent some time looking into this issue. I noticed that, when attempting to connect to a CIMOM w/ no password, via HTTPS, the following exception is thrown:

WARNING: exception while connection to server
java.io.IOException: Unexpected EOF
	at org.sblim.wbem.http.HttpMethod.readLine(HttpMethod.java:64)
	at org.sblim.wbem.http.HttpClientMethod.<init>(HttpClientMethod.java:60)
	at org.sblim.wbem.http.HttpClient.getResponseCode(HttpClient.java:564)
	at org.sblim.wbem.http.HttpUrlConnection.getResponseCode(HttpUrlConnection.java:210)
	at org.sblim.wbem.client.CIMClientXML.transmitRequest(CIMClientXML.java:1670)
	at org.sblim.wbem.client.CIMClientXML.enumerateClassNames(CIMClientXML.java:965)
	at org.sblim.wbem.client.CIMClient.enumerateClassNames(CIMClient.java:2983)
	at org.sblim.wbem.client.CIMClient.enumerateClassNames(CIMClient.java:2938)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:585)
	at org.eclipse.aperi.disk.common.util.thread.DiskMgrThread.run(DiskMgrThread.java:257)

Having looked at the CIM client code a bit, the exception above appears to be the root cause of the authorization error reported in this bug report.  As Marcus suggested, I think it'd be a good idea to get the CIM client folks involved in solving this problem, as the problem may actually be somewhere in their code. Marcus, would it be possible for you to discuss this issue w/ Thorsten?

This is adressed to the SBLIM CIMClient team already.
Expecting feedback on 2006/12/15.
As we've discussed, I've lowered the priority to P3 as we do not view this as a release stopper. We're looking to get a fix from the CIM client folks.
Lower the severity to be enhancement
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 199467 ***
